contentrichtext.text: {{Japanese name|Tanaka}} {{Infobox musical artist |name=Hirokazu Tanaka |native_name=田中 宏和 |native_name_lang=jpn |image= |caption= |image_size= |background=non_vocal_instrumentalist |birth_name= |alias= |birth_date={{birth date and age|1957|12|15}} |birth_place=[[Kyoto]], [[Japan]] |genre=[[Chiptune]] |occupation=[[Composer]] |years_active=1980–present |instrument= |label= |associated_acts= |website=http://www.hirokazutanaka.com/ |notable_instruments= }} {{nihongo|'''Hirokazu "Hip" Tanaka'''|田中 宏和|Tanaka Hirokazu|born December 13, 1957}}<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hirokazutanaka.com/biography.html |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5vVtiV8GO |title=Biography |work=Sporadic Vacuum |publisher=Hirokazu Tanaka |accessdate=5 January 2010 |archivedate=5 January 2010}}</ref> is a [[Japan]]ese [[composer]] and [[music]]ian, best known for his scores for various [[video game]]s produced by [[Nintendo]]. He is also the current President of [[Creatures (company)|Creatures, Inc.]] ==Video game soundtracks== *''[[List of Game & Watch games|Mickey & Donald]]'' (1982) *''[[List of Game & Watch games|Donkey Kong 2]]'' (1982) *''[[Donkey Kong 3]]'' (1983) *''[[List of Game & Watch games|Pinball]]'' (1983) *''[[List of Game & Watch games|Mario’s Cement Factory]]'' (1983) *''[[List of Game & Watch games|Donkey Kong Jr.]]'' (1983) *''[[List of Game & Watch games|Snoopy]]'' (1983) *''[[List of Game & Watch games|Popeye]]'' (1983) *''[[List of Mario LCD games#Mario's Bombs Away|Mario's Bombs Away]]'' (1983) *''[[List of Game & Watch games|Spitball Sparky]]'' (1984) *''[[Wild Gunman]]'' (1984) *''[[Duck Hunt]]'' (1984) *''[[Hogan's Alley (video game)|Hogan's Alley]]'' (1984) *''[[Urban Champion]]'' (1984) *''[[Balloon Fight]]'' (1985) *''[[Wrecking Crew (video game)|Wrecking Crew]]'' (1985) *''[[Stack-Up]]'' (1985) *''[[Gyromite]]'' (1985) *''[[Gumshoe (video game)|Gumshoe]]'' (1986) *''[[Metroid (video game)|Metroid]]'' (1986) *''[[Kid Icarus]]'' (1986) *''[[Famicom Wars]]'' (1988) *''[[Alleyway]]'' (1989) *''[[Baseball (1983 video game)|Baseball]]'' (1989) *''[[Super Mario Land]]'' (1989) *''[[Yakuman (video game)|Yakuman]]'' (1989) *''[[Tetris (Game Boy)|Tetris]]'' (1989) *''[[Mother (video game)|Mother]]'' (with [[Keiichi Suzuki (composer)|Keiichi Suzuki]]) (1989) *''[[Golf (video game)|Golf]]'' (1989) *''[[Knight Move]]'' (1989) *''[[Dr. Mario]]'' (1990) *''[[Barker Bill's Trick Shooting]]'' (1990) *''[[Balloon Kid]]'' (''Balloon Fight GB'' in Japan) (1990) *''[[Hello Kitty World]]'' (1992) *''[[Mario Paint]]'' (1992) (with Ryoji Yoshitomi and [[Kazumi Totaka]]) *''[[X (1992 video game)|X]]'' (1992) (with [[Kazumi Totaka]]) *''[[EarthBound]]'' (''Mother 2'', 1994, with [[Keiichi Suzuki (composer)|Keiichi Suzuki]]) *''[[Snoopy Concert]]'' (with Minako Hamano) (1995) *''[[Game Boy Camera]]'' (1998) ===Other=== *''[[Fire Emblem Gaiden]]'' (1992 Supervisor) *''[[Fire Emblem: Monshō no Nazo]]'' (1994 Special Thanks) *''Fire Emblem Character theme'' (1990 CD Production) *Various songs for the [[Pokémon (anime)|''Pokémon'' anime]] including the songs on the [[Meowth's Party#CD single|Meowth's Party single]]. *''[[Play For Japan: The Album]]'' (2011) ==References== {{reflist}} *{{cite
